title: Games
section: How to build the web version (using pygbag)
text:
How to build the web version (using pygbag)

Install pygbag:

python -m pip install pygbag

Put your game in a folder with a main.py at the root.
Make your main loop async-aware (pygbag expects this). Then build:

pygbag path/to/your/game_folder

The output will include an index.html plus assets. Copy the output folder into misc/game_build/.

Tip: keep the game folder small - large assets can slow initial load.

title: Math lesson (demo)
text:
title: “Math lesson (demo)”
This is a starter lesson page. Quarto supports LaTeX-style math directly.

title: Math lesson (demo)
text:
Example: Taylor series
We can write inline math like \(e^{i\pi} + 1 = 0\) and displayed equations:
\[
e^x = \sum_{n=0}^{\infty}\frac{x^n}{n!}.
\]

title: Math lesson (demo)
text:
Example: A figure
Place images in lessons/img/ and reference them like this:

title: Math lesson (demo)
text:
Notes

If you generate images from Python/Matlab, export them as PNG/SVG and drop them into lessons/img/.
You can also write lessons as Jupyter notebooks (.ipynb) if you want code+output.
